question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure to ensure the generated code is executable for demonstration. Implement a design draft review system that supports Sketch/PSD file preview, allows reviewers to select areas on design drawings and add comments, provides multi-version comparison views (with left-right sliding comparison), and automatically generates a summary document of modification suggestions (sorted by number of comments).

checklist.title: Is the file upload and preview system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code implements proper file uploading for Sketch/PSD files, handles file validation, and converts these design files into viewable formats (SVG/PNG) on the web interface. Check if there's progress indication during upload/conversion. Score 0 if there's no file handling, 5 if only basic upload exists without proper preview, and 10 if the system handles both Sketch and PSD files with proper preview rendering.

checklist.title: Is the area selection and commenting feature properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate if the implementation allows users to select specific areas of design drawings (rectangular/polygon/freeform selection), attach comments to these selections, and display them appropriately. Check if selection coordinates are properly stored and if selected areas remain visible when hovering over corresponding comments. Deduct 5 points if only rectangular selection is available, 3 points if selection coordinates aren't preserved across sessions, and 2 points if there's no visual indication of commented areas. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the multi-version comparison view functioning correctly?
checklist.description: Check if the system can load and display different versions of the same design for comparison (side-by-side or overlay). Verify if the left-right sliding comparison works smoothly with synchronized zooming/panning. Test if differences between versions are highlighted or can be automatically detected. Deduct 5 points if comparison view lacks synchronization between versions, 3 points if zooming causes misalignment, and 5 points if the slider mechanism is jerky or imprecise. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the automatic summary generation work as expected?
checklist.description: Verify if the system aggregates comments and generates a structured summary document. Check if comments are properly categorized, sorted by frequency/importance, and if the summary includes screenshots of commented areas. Evaluate if the summary can be exported in common formats (PDF, DOC). Deduct 5 points if sorting by comment count doesn't work, 3 points if there's no categorization feature, and 5 points if export functionality is missing or broken. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as corrupted design files, browser compatibility issues, large file uploads, concurrent edits, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Check if there's proper validation for all user inputs and API responses. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. AI-powered design suggestions 2. Automatic design consistency checking 3. User activity heat maps showing most commented areas 4. Voice comments with transcription). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple ways to add the same type of comment) 2. Function modules unrelated to design review (e.g., a built-in chat system unrelated to commenting) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., unnecessary animations that slow down the review process). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating file handling/UI/comment management layers), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Check if rendering optimization is implemented for large design files. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Check if the interface maintains clarity while displaying complex design assets. Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance. Test specifically for responsiveness during design asset manipulation (zooming, panning, selecting). Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast sliding, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
